title: Pharmacy Student Orientation: Escape Game-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational pharmaceutical theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: Pharmacy program orientation for current practitioners, aiming to foster peer collaboration and policy familiarity

learning_goals: Learners enhance collaborative skills with peers while completing escape game missions within 30 minutes.
Learners accurately identify the roles of core personnel in the program with over 80% accuracy.
Learners understand and apply key policies specified in the student handbook with over 90% accuracy.

resources: Escape Game Equipment (Locks, Clue Cards, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
